attributes.name: data-source
attributes.description: Location of the CSV file.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

attributes.name: raw-data
attributes.description: Raw data pulled in from the csv file.

attributes.name: reverse-data
attributes.description:
Reverse data including labels, the series order as well as
the whole series data arrays.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: Fixed width for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

properties.name: dataSource
properties.description: Location of the CSV file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

attributes.name: chartPadding
attributes.description: Padding of chart drawing area to container element and labels

attributes.name: donut
attributes.description: Displays chart as donut instead of pie.

attributes.name: donutSolid
attributes.description: Draw donut segments as shapes instead of strokes.

attributes.name: donutWidth
attributes.description: Donut stroke width, currently done in javascript.

attributes.name: ignoreEmptyValues
attributes.description:
Empty values will be ignored to avoid drawing
unncessary slices and labels

attributes.name: labelDirection
attributes.description:
Label direction can be 'neutral', 'explode' or 'implode'.
The labels anchor will be positioned based on those settings
as well as the fact if the labels are on the right or
left side of the center of the chart.
Usually explode is useful when labels are positioned
far away from the center.

attributes.name: labelOffset
attributes.description:
Label position offset from the standard position
which is half distance of the radius.
This value can be either positive or negative.
Positive values will position the label away from the center.

attributes.name: labelPosition
attributes.description:
This option can be set to 'inside', 'outside' or 'center'.
Positioned with 'inside' the labels will be placed on half the distance
of the radius to the border of the Pie by respecting the 'labelOffset'.
The 'outside' option will place the labels at the border of the pie
and 'center' will place the labels in the absolute center point
of the chart. The 'center' option only makes sense
in conjunction with the 'labelOffset' option.

attributes.name: showLabel
attributes.description: If a label should be shown.

attributes.name: startAngle
attributes.description:
Start angle of the pie chart in degrees where 0 points north.
A higher value offsets the start angle clockwise..

attributes.name: total
attributes.description:
Optional total you can specify. By specifying a total value,
the sum of the values in the series must be this total in order
to draw a full pie. You can use this parameter to draw only parts
of a pie or gauge charts.

attributes.name: area-base
attributes.description:
The base for the area chart that will be used
to close the area shape (is normally 0).

attributes.name: full-width
attributes.description:
When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis
is not drawn and the chart elements will expand
to the full available width of the chart.
For the last label to be drawn correctly
you might need to add chart padding or offset the
last label with a draw event handler.

attributes.name: line-smooth
attributes.description:
Specify if the lines should be smoothed.
This value can be true or false where true
will result in smoothing using the default
smoothing interpolation function Chartist.
Interpolation.cardinal and false results in
Chartist.Interpolation.none.
You can also choose other smoothing /
interpolation functions available in the Chartist.
Interpolation module, or write your own
interpolation function. Check the examples
for a brief description..

attributes.name: show-area
attributes.description: If the line chart should draw an area.

attributes.name: show-line
attributes.description: If the line should be drawn or not.

attributes.name: show-point
attributes.description: If the line should be drawn or not.

to close the area shape (is normally 0).

properties.name: fullWidth
properties.description:
When set to true, the last grid line on the x-axis
is not drawn and the chart elements will expand
to the full available width of the chart.
For the last label to be drawn correctly
you might need to add chart padding or offset the
last label with a draw event handler.

properties.name: lineSmooth
properties.description:
Specify if the lines should be smoothed.
This value can be true or false where true
will result in smoothing using the default

Interpolation.cardinal and false results in

You can also choose other smoothing /
interpolation functions available in the Chartist.
Interpolation module, or write your own

for a brief description..

properties.name: showArea
properties.description: If the line chart should draw an area.

properties.description: If the line should be drawn or not.

properties.name: dataSource
properties.description: Location of the CSV file.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Fixed height for the chart as a string (i.e. '100px' or '50%').

properties.name: rawData

properties.name: reverseData

properties.name: width

attributes.name: axis-x-only-integer
attributes.description: Use only integer values (whole numbers) for the scale steps

attributes.name: axis-x-min-space
attributes.description: TODO

attributes.name: distribute-series
attributes.description:
If set to true then each bar will represent a series and
the data array is expected to be a one dimensional array
of data values rather than a series array of series.
This is useful if the bar chart should represent
a profile rather than some data over time.

attributes.name: horizontal-bars
attributes.description:
Inverts the axes of the bar chart in order to draw
a horizontal bar chart. Be aware that you also need
to invert your axis settings as the Y Axis will now display
the labels and the X Axis the values.

attributes.name: reference-value
attributes.description:
Unless low/high are explicitly set, bar chart will be
centered at zero by default. Set referenceValue to null to auto scale.

attributes.name: series-bar-distance
attributes.description: Specify the distance in pixel of bars in a group.

attributes.name: stack-bars
attributes.description:
If set to true this property will cause the series bars
to be stacked. Check the "stackMode" option
for further stacking options.

attributes.name: stack-mode
attributes.description:
If set to "true" this property will form a total
for each series point. This will also influence
the y-axis and the overall bounds of the chart.
If set to "false" this property will force
the stacked bars to draw from the zero line.
In stacked mode the "seriesBarDistance" property will have no effect.
